name: VOA Mid-States Restorative Justice Program
description: Comprehensive restorative justice program providing facilitated processes for youth harmed by crime or wrongdoing to meet with those who caused harm, negotiating resolutions outside traditional systems. Offers alternatives to detention, community mediation, and school-based programs. Serves multiple Kentucky counties including Jefferson, Hardin, Bullitt, Fayette, Scott, Madison, Clark, Jessamine, Franklin, Rockcastle, Jackson, Pulaski, Laurel, Clay, Leslie, McCreary, Whitley, Knox, Warren, and Christian counties.
source: Verified from official website and multiple authoritative sources
eligibility_requirements: Youth and young adults involved in the justice system, school referrals, and community members seeking conflict resolution. Services available to individuals in Jefferson, Hardin, Bullitt, Fayette, Scott, Madison, Clark, Jessamine, Franklin, Rockcastle, Jackson, Pulaski, Laurel, Clay, Leslie, McCreary, Whitley, Knox, Warren, and Christian counties.
populations_served: Youth and young adults involved in justice system, students, families, victims, offenders, and community members seeking conflict resolution
cost_information: Services provided free of charge to eligible participants
